page.title: 04"Bowcombe"-Cheverton Farm 2.
page.content: Like other farms in the area; a farm at this place is mentioned in the original{Domesday Book.}Indeed the present owner has a detailed family tree of the Chiverton family going back to 1616 when the first farm of this name was built. Interestingly; in 1657 the then owner Richard Chiverton was Lord Mayor of London, was Knighted by Cromwell, and later again by Charles II. Unlike other farms in the area, but reflecting a growing response from farmers to the special problems of agriculture in the late twentieth century; the farm itself, now managed by the owner's son, is only one of the enterprises of its owner.{From part of {the farm he quarries and sells chalk {and shingle, and on an adjacent site {outside the area he operates a holiday {camp and caravan site.
